subject: Olympic Games (2008)
lead_paragraph: Stung by flagging fortunes in recent years, the Kenyan athletics board spelled out tough measures to impose discipline ahead of the Beijing Olympics, officials said. Athletics Kenya (A.K.) ordered 119 men and women to the western town of Eldoret by May 20 to train for the Games, where Kenya has vowed to revive its fading reputation. “We are not going to favor anyone,” said the A.K. chief Isaiah Kiplagat. “Whether you are the best in the world today or a favorite in Beijing, you must attend the camp or be left out.”.
